triplets: Circular band worn on finger as jewelry or symbolic ornament
Fashion accessory, marriage/engagement, awards, religious or cultural symbolism, and identification
Gold, silver, platinum, titanium, stainless steel, gemstones, diamonds, or synthetic materials
Band, setting, gemstone (if any), engraving area, and sometimes decorative patterns
Metallic tones (yellow, white, rose gold) or colored by gemstones (clear, red, blue, etc.)
Jewelry collections, ceremonial traditions, and personal adornment
Jewelers, jewelry brands, artisans, and manufacturers like Cartier, Tiffany, or local craftsmen
Typically 1.5–2.5 cm inner diameter, depending on finger size
Approximately 2–20 grams depending on material and design
Can last generations with proper care; metal rings may last indefinitely
